title: Kruidenpower
description:
Kruidenpower is a website that showcases the herbal medicine business of [Nicole Trompter](https://nicoletrompetter.nl). The site provides users with essential information about her services, products, and what she can and cannot assist with. Although alternative medicine is not something I would typically use, I found working on this website to be an exciting and informative experience.

Kruidenpower was also the first job I undertook as a ZZP'er, and it proved to be a crucial learning opportunity. During the project, I experimented with various platforms and technologies, leading me to discover my preferred technology stack for non-interactive websites. Ultimately, I settled on Nuxt 3, which I hosted on [Netlifyâ€™s platform](https://www.netlify.com/). I also integrated [Decap](https://decapcms.org/) to streamline content management.

I appreciate the simplicity of Nuxt 3 for somewhat static sites such as Kruidenpower. While it may not be suitable for more complex websites or applications requiring authentication, it was perfect for this project!

In addition to Kruidenpower, I also created a portfolio for Nicole Trompter. Although it was a small website, it was a pleasure to work on. However, I felt that it didn't adequately showcase my skills, so I decided not to include it in my portfolio.

Overall, working on Kruidenpower and Nicole Trompter's portfolio was a fulfilling experience that allowed me to refine my skills and develop a better understanding of my preferred technology stack for non-interactive websites.
short: Kruidenpower is a website showcasing the herbal medicine business of Nicole Trompter. I used Nuxt 3, hosted on Netlify, and integrated Decap for content management. A great learning opportunity that allowed me to refine my skills and develop a better understanding of non-interactive websites.
